org.cleartk.util
Class PlainTextCollectionReader

java.lang.Object
  org.apache.uima.resource.Resource_ImplBase
      org.apache.uima.resource.ConfigurableResource_ImplBase
          org.apache.uima.collection.CollectionReader_ImplBase
              org.cleartk.util.PlainTextCollectionReader
All Implemented Interfaces:
BaseCollectionReader, CollectionReader, ConfigurableResource, Resource
Direct Known Subclasses:
XReader
public class PlainTextCollectionReader
extends CollectionReader_ImplBase


Copyright (c) 2007-2008, Regents of the University of Colorado
All rights reserved.

A CollectionReader that loads all files in a directory tree. Files are loaded as plain text and stored in the JCas view selected by the user. ClearTK Document objects are added to the same JCas view to record the file IDs and paths.

Author:
Steven Bethard, Philip Ogren

Field Detail

PARAM_FILE_OR_DIRECTORY

public static final String PARAM_FILE_OR_DIRECTORY
"FileOrDirectory" is a single, required, string parameter that takes either the name of a single file or the root directory containing all the files to be processed.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

PARAM_VIEW_NAME

public static final String PARAM_VIEW_NAME
"ViewName" is a single, optional, string parameter that takes the the name that should be given to the JCas view associated with the document texts.

See Also:
UIMAUtil.createJCasView(CAS, String), Constant Field Values

PARAM_LANGUAGE

public static final String PARAM_LANGUAGE
"Language" is a single, optional, string parameter that takes the language code corresponding to the language of the documents being examined. The value of this parameter is simply passed on to JCas.setDocumentLanguage(String).

See Also:
JCas.setDocumentLanguage(String), Constant Field Values

PARAM_ENCODING

public static final String PARAM_ENCODING
"Encoding" is a single, optional, string parameter that takes the encoding of the text files (e.g. "UTF-8").

See Also:
for a list of encoding names., Constant Field Values

PARAM_SUFFIXES

public static final String PARAM_SUFFIXES
"Suffixes" is a multiple, optional, string parameter that takes suffixes (e.g. .txt) of the files that should be read in.

See Also:
